data.question: What is the empirical formula of ITC-1?
What is the space group of ITC-2?
What is the crystal system of ITC-3?
What is the percentage of void space in ITC-4?
What is the formula weight of ITC-2NH2?
Does ITC-2Br have a higher formula weight than ITC-2?
Is the crystal system of ITC-4 cubic?
Is the density of ITC-3 higher than that of ITC-4?
What is the absorption coefficient of ITC-1?
What is the final R indices [I > 2Ïƒ(I)] for ITC-2?
What is the temperature used for the synthesis of ITC-3?
Does the synthesis of ITC-4 require a higher temperature than ITC-3?
Is the volume of ITC-2 larger than that of ITC-3?
Can ITC-4 selectively exchange -1 charged dyes?
What is the reason for the selective ion exchange in ITC-4?
data.answer: The selective ion exchange in ITC-4 is due to its positive framework which allows for charge-selective ion exchange of anionic dyes.

data.question: Why does ITC-4 have a higher ion-exchange capacity for OG2- compared to MB2-?
data.answer: ITC-4 has a higher ion-exchange capacity for OG2- compared to MB2- due to the size-exclusion effect, where MB2- is too large to enter the pores of ITC-4.

data.question: What is the role of NaNO3 in the release experiment of ITC-4?
data.answer: NaNO3 triggers the release of the previously exchanged dye from ITC-4 by displacing the dye through ion-exchange.
